sentence.Network_en: Was coming home to Tara to mean, not blessed surcease, but only more loads to carry?
sentence.Network_cn: 难道回到塔拉并不意味着幸福的休息, 反而是更重的负担 吗 ?

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): from Old French sursis, past participle of Old French surseoir 'refrain, delay', from Latin supersedere (see supersede). The change in the ending was due to association with cease; the noun dates from the late 16th cent

auth_sentence.content: Sculptured forms piled overhead, one into another without surcease.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sculptured forms piled overhead, one into another without surcease.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sculptured forms piled overhead, one into another without surcease.
